abstract: The Financial Services Authority on Monday fined HSBC £10.5 million for selling inappropriate financial products to elderly customers, the largest British penalty related to a retail product.
snippet: The Financial Services Authority on Monday fined HSBC £10.5 million for selling inappropriate financial products to elderly customers, the largest British penalty related to a retail product.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — British authorities on Monday fined HSBC £10.5 million, or $16.4 million, for selling inappropriate financial products to elderly customers, the largest penalty related to a retail product.

headline.main: HSBC Fined for Selling Unsuitable Investments to the Elderly
